result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian C Pergande was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
As of 12-6-2016:   Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.   Refund check was issued to deft./poster.

Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month (w/payment plan fee of $15.00)  commencing 12/01/2014; alternate 5 days jail.

With Huber.
Standard release conditions.
Court grants jail sentence to be transferred to Milwaukee County, WITHOUT Electronic Monitoring.
COMMENCE 11/03/2014 by 6PM.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Brian C Pergande in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  Brad D. Schimel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed by the State.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty. State is requesting a different date for sentencing. The victim is not present. Bail stands as fixed. with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  Returned to defense counsel.

Defendant Brian C Pergande in court with attorney Michael John Steinle.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense would like to proceed to plea/sentencing this morning.  Brad D. Schimel now appears for the State of Wisconsin.  The State files an Amended Information.   Defense waives reading of the Amended Information.      Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court does not accept the plea.  Court asks the defense how they want to proceed.  Defense requests a status/trial date.  Court grants request.  Court directs the clerk to return the plea form to defense counsel and the Amended Information to the State of Wisconsin.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian C Pergande in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gave Defense discovery materials in Court. Atty. Steinle needs to review discovery and discuss this matter with DA Schimel. Atty. Steinle requests a date in 30 - 40 days. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brian C Pergande in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Susan L Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Steinle requests all witnesses be sequestered Detective Robert Wetfer from the Waukesha Sheriff's Department, sworn and testified. Exhibits #1 through #4 marked. Cross examination by Atty. Steinle. Re direct by Atty. Schimel. Atty. Schimel requests all exhibits be received. No objection by Atty. Steinle. Court receives exhibits #1 through #4. Petitioner rests. No testimony provided by the defense. Testimony closed. Closing statements presented by the State and State requests a bind over. Closing statements presented by Atty. Steinle and objects to bind over.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to have no contact with witness, Melissa J. listed in criminal complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
